page.title: 02Bridgnorth 1985
page.content: In the 20th. century, the character of Bridgnorth has changed dramatically. Most of the 11,000 people living in the town are forced to travel to the West Midland conurbation for work and in effect Bridgnorth is a dormitory town. The industries of the town employ little more than 1,000 of the working inhabitants and although others work in shops, offices and commercial enterprises in Bridgnorth, the main roads out of town are very busy both morning and evening as workers leave and return to their homes. Housing developments have sprung up all around the town, but the town centre remains largely unchanged with narrow streets and the usual traffic congestion associated with market towns. Kidderminster is 21 kilometres away, Wolverhampton 24 kilometres and Shrewsbury 33 kms.
